Package ch.nolix.element.font

Class Font

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.nolix.element.core.Element
      • ch.nolix.element.font.Font
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Typed, TypeRequestable, Specified, IElement

    public final class Font
extends Element
    A font can paint texts with a specific text font, text size and text color. A font is not mutable.
    Author:
    Silvan Wyss

      • getFirstPart

        public java.lang.String getFirstPart​(java.lang.String text,
                                     int maxWidth)
        Parameters:
        text -
        maxWidth -
        Returns:
        the first part of the given text this font can paint that is not longer than the given max width.
        Throws:
        NegativeArgumentException - if the given max width is negative.

      • getFirstPart

        public java.lang.String getFirstPart​(java.lang.String text,
                                     int maxWidth,
                                     boolean attachEllipsis)
        Parameters:
        text -
        maxWidth -
        ellipsis -
        Returns:
        the first part of the given text this font can paint, that is not longer than the given max width, optionally with an ellipsis if the given text is longer than the given max width.

      • getFirstPartWithProbableEllipsis

        public java.lang.String getFirstPartWithProbableEllipsis​(java.lang.String text,
                                                         int maxWidth)
        Parameters:
        text -
        maxWidth -
        Returns:
        the first part of the given text this font can paint, that is not longer than the given max width, with an ellipsis if the given text is longer than the given max width.
        Throws:
        NegativeArgumentException - if the given max width is negative.

      • getTextHeight

        public final int getTextHeight​()
        The text size is normative. The text height depends on the text font and can differ.
        Returns:
        the text height of this font.

      • getTextSize

        public int getTextSize​()
        Returns:
        the text size of this font.

      • getTextWidth

        public final int getTextWidth​(java.lang.String text)
        Returns:
        the width of the given text when this font would be applied to it.

      • paintText

        public void paintText​(java.lang.String text,
                      int maxWidth,
                      java.awt.Graphics graphics)
        Lets this font paint the given text using the given graphics. Only the first part of the given text that is not longer than the given max width will be painted.
        Parameters:
        text -
        graphics -

      • paintText

        public void paintText​(java.lang.String text,
                      int maxWidth,
                      java.awt.Graphics graphics,
                      int xPosition,
                      int yPosition)
        Lets this font paint the given text at the given position using the given graphics. Only the first part of the given text that is not longer than the given max width will be painted.
        Parameters:
        text -
        maxWidth -
        graphics -
        xPosition -
        yPosition -
        Throws:
        NegativeArgumentException - if the given max width is negative.
